articles.author: Gabriella Borter
articles.description: An hour after Rabbi Jonathan Leener put out a call for donations among his small Brooklyn synagogue community, he had raised $5,000. Soon he had taken in enough supplies to fill an SUV.
articles.title: With bulletproof vests, socks and soap, US Jews rush to aid Israel

articles.author: Steven Scheer, Michael Kahn, Tim Hepher
articles.description: Governments and airlines scrambled to lay on flights to evacuate thousands of tourists from Israel and repatriate the country's citizens, as the industry faced a warning over insurance cover in the wake of weekend attacks.
articles.title: Governments join rescue effort as airlines face Israel insurance alert

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken landed in Tel Aviv on Thursday as part of a Middle East tour to show Washington's solidarity with Israel after the attacks by Palestinian Hamas militants and to work to prevent the conflict from widening.
articles.title: U.S. Secretary of State Blinken lands in Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The X social media platform has removed hundreds of Hamas-affiliated accounts and taken action to remove or label tens of thousands of pieces of content since the militant group's attack on Israel, its chief executive Linda officer Yaccarino said on Thursday.
articles.title: X removes hundreds of Hamas-affiliated accounts since attack, CEO says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A group of independent United Nations experts on Thursday condemned violence against civilians in Israel and deplored the "collective punishment" of reprisal strikes against Gaza.
articles.title: UN experts say Israel's strikes on Gaza amount to 'collective punishment'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman discussed the Palestinian-Israeli conflict on Wednesday, in the first telephone call between the two leaders since a China-brokered deal between Tehran and Riyadh to resume ties.
articles.title: Iran president, Saudi crown prince speak for first time since ties restored

articles.author: Emily Rose, Ilan Rosenberg
articles.description: Israeli paramedic Hami Atias has seen much death and gore over 21 years of treating victims of violent attacks, natural disasters and war wounded. But the scene that greeted him at a leafy kibbutz near Gaza at the weekend will haunt him forever.
articles.title: Gore, gunfights and hostage-taking scar kibbutz dwellers

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Most of the 2.3 million people in the Gaza Strip have no electricity and no water. And, with hundreds of Israeli strikes raining down on their tiny enclave, they have nowhere to run.
articles.title: Gazans bombarded by Israel have no hope and no escape

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Wednesday warned Iran against getting involved in Israel's conflict with Hamas amid fears of a wider regional conflict, while Israeli leaders formed an emergency war cabinet to present a united front.
articles.title: Biden warns Iran over Gaza; Israel forms emergency war cabinet

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Samuel Indyk
articles.title: Morning Bid: Fed's data-driven approach set for inflation test
